page.title: 08THE M25
page.content: The M25 Outer Orbital route around London will soon complete the 118 mile long loop of motorway around the outer regions of London. The original concept was formulated before the WW2. After much consultation/protest construction began in the late 1970s. In 1985 the building is almost complete .The 118 mile route should be fully operational by the end of 1986. The busiest sections have been specially adapted for heavy traffic_ the first British motorway to have four lanes. At least 3 service areas are planned though decisions about where to place them have yet to be made. The M25 should lessen congestion on London streets. The route will cross the M4 close to the existing M4/ A4 interchange at Langley passing through the area east of Yiewsley.
